instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Overheating
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here that gets hot and then turns off. I have linked a video below from the thermal camera to show what is getting hot. The cpu is getting red hot, the first IC that appears to be hot is <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and also L7210 is getting red hot. I'm not sure if <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> is bad, or if the cpu is bad and causing <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> to overheat or what the issue is. As I have looked over the board with the thermal camera and the CPU, <CHIP>U7210</CHIP> and L7210 stick out more than anything.  If I probe at L7210 I get 016.4ohm .
[MEDIA=youtube]kh-<SIGNAL>P_5ZETMS</SIGNAL>[/MEDIA]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Overheating
threads.message:
How the problem appeared?

Check <RESISTOR>R7237</RESISTOR> and R/<CAPACITOR>C7239</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Overheating
threads.message: Customer just said it started turning off one day. Hasn’t had liquid damage, can’t see any sign of it. Will check those in a moment.
